section.title: Context
section.p: While Fluenta is designed to work with local DITA files, you can still process remote DITA Maps by first downloading the map and its referenced topics locally. Once all necessary files are on your computer, Fluenta can parse the map and generate the XLIFF file as usual.

section.title: Steps to Prepare a Remote DITAMap for Fluenta
section.p: To use a remote DITAMap with Fluenta, follow these steps to export the content locally:

li.p: Open the remote DITAMap file in the DITA Maps Manager.
From the toolbar, select DITA Maps â†’ Export DITA Map...
In the dialog box that appears, specify the folder where the DITAMap and its referenced topics should be exported locally. You can also choose to export the content as a ZIP archive.
Open the newly exported local DITAMap in the DITA Maps Manager and create a Fluenta project using this local version.

section.title: Conclusion
section.p: Although Fluenta requires local access to DITA content, remote DITAMaps can be easily adapted by exporting them and their referenced topics to your local environment. This workflow ensures compatibility with Fluenta's translation process while allowing you to keep a centralized content management approach.
